scenarioDescription:
The Teegarden's Star Exoplanetary System


Overview

Teegarden's Star is a star with 0.09 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.11 times its radius. It is located 12.49 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Teegarden's Star is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Teegarden's Star system


Teegarden's Star b

Teegarden's Star b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2019-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Teegarden's Star b is 1.049 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Teegarden's Star b is 1.020 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Teegarden's Star b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.


Teegarden's Star c

Teegarden's Star c was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2019-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Teegarden's Star c is 1.110 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Teegarden's Star c is 1.040 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Teegarden's Star c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars. Teegarden's Star c orbits within the habitable zone of its parent star and could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Teegarden's Star, which contains 2 exoplanets, of which 1 is potentially habitable, and was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory.
name: Teegarden's Star - Multiplanetary System With Smallest Range In Planetary Mass
fileName: Teegarden's Star - System With 2 Exolanets of Which 1 Is Potentially Habitable
